com.iota.iri.utils.thread

Interface ReportingExecutorService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BoundedScheduledExecutorService, DedicatedScheduledExecutorService

    public interface ReportingExecutorService
    This interface defines a contract for ExecutorServices that makes them call a "reporting" method whenever an important event occurs.

    This way a child class extending these kind of ExecutorServices can "hook" into these events by overriding the specific method and add additional logic like logging or debugging capabilities.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onCancelTask(TaskDetails taskDetails)
      This method gets called whenever a task is cancelled through its Future or through the shutdown methods of the ExecutorService.

      It only gets called once for every task.
      void onCompleteTask(TaskDetails taskDetails, java.lang.Throwable error)
      This method gets called whenever a task completes.

      This can be through either raising an exception, cancelling from the outside or by simply terminating in a normal manner.
      void onFinishTask(TaskDetails taskDetails, java.lang.Throwable error)
      This method gets called whenever a task is finished.

      For recurring tasks it is called multiple times.
      void onScheduleTask(TaskDetails taskDetails)
      This method gets called whenever a new task is scheduled to run.

      In contrast to onStartTask(TaskDetails) this method gets called only once for "recurring" tasks that are scheduled to run in pre-defined intervals.
      void onStartTask(TaskDetails taskDetails)
      This method gets called whenever a task is started.

      For recurring tasks it is called multiple times.

    • Method Detail

      • onScheduleTask

        void onScheduleTask(TaskDetails taskDetails)
        This method gets called whenever a new task is scheduled to run.

        In contrast to onStartTask(TaskDetails) this method gets called only once for "recurring" tasks that are scheduled to run in pre-defined intervals.
        Parameters:
        taskDetails - object containing details about this task

      • onStartTask

        void onStartTask(TaskDetails taskDetails)
        This method gets called whenever a task is started.

        For recurring tasks it is called multiple times.
        Parameters:
        taskDetails - object containing details about this task

      • onFinishTask

        void onFinishTask(TaskDetails taskDetails,
                  java.lang.Throwable error)
        This method gets called whenever a task is finished.

        For recurring tasks it is called multiple times.
        Parameters:
        taskDetails - object containing details about this task

      • onCancelTask

        void onCancelTask(TaskDetails taskDetails)
        This method gets called whenever a task is cancelled through its Future or through the shutdown methods of the ExecutorService.

        It only gets called once for every task.
        Parameters:
        taskDetails - object containing details about this task

      • onCompleteTask

        void onCompleteTask(TaskDetails taskDetails,
                    java.lang.Throwable error)
        This method gets called whenever a task completes.

        This can be through either raising an exception, cancelling from the outside or by simply terminating in a normal manner. For recurring tasks this only gets called once.
        Parameters:
        taskDetails - object containing details about this task
